metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8933 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Libmenu-cache 1.0.2 insecurely uses /tmp for a socket file, allowing a local user to cause a denial of service (menu unavailability).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmenu-cache-bin - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
libmenu-cache3 - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> The security fix only works when compiled against a new-enough glib: 2.28.0. The commit message also says only menu-cache >= 0.7.0.

criterions.comment: menu-cache package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1').
